fields.description:
TestUberAM is failing
{noformat}
java.lang.AssertionError: No AppMaster log found! expected:<1> but was:<2>
	at org.junit.Assert.fail(Assert.java:88)
	at org.junit.Assert.failNotEquals(Assert.java:743)
	at org.junit.Assert.assertEquals(Assert.java:118)
	at org.junit.Assert.assertEquals(Assert.java:555)
	at org.apache.hadoop.mapreduce.v2.TestMRJobs.testThreadDumpOnTaskTimeout(TestMRJobs.java:1228)
	at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke0(Native Method)
	at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(NativeMethodAccessorImpl.java:62)
	at sun.reflect.DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.java:43)
	at java.lang.reflect.Method.invoke(Method.java:498)
	at org.junit.runners.model.FrameworkMethod$1.runReflectiveCall(FrameworkMethod.java:47)
	at org.junit.internal.runners.model.ReflectiveCallable.run(ReflectiveCallable.java:12)
	at org.junit.runners.model.FrameworkMethod.invokeExplosively(FrameworkMethod.java:44)
	at org.junit.internal.runners.statements.InvokeMethod.evaluate(InvokeMethod.java:17)
	at org.junit.internal.runners.statements.FailOnTimeout$StatementThread.run(FailOnTimeout.java:74)
{noformat}
https://builds.apache.org/job/hadoop-qbt-trunk-java8-linux-x86/614/testReport/junit/org.apache.hadoop.mapreduce.v2/TestUberAM/testThreadDumpOnTaskTimeout/
fields.summary: Task timeout in uber mode can crash AM

comments.body: Assigning this to myself - it failed in our environment, too.

Ok, I found out the problem. It's caused by MAPREDUCE-5124 and the fact that a thread is not stopped.

1. Mapper is running in uber mode inside the AM
2. Mapper is timed out
3. Uber launcher calls {{future.cancel()}} which results in an {{InterruptedException}}
4. Background task reporter ("communication thread") keeps running
5. Task attempt is unregistered and removed from {{attemptIdToStatus}} map
6. Task reporter calls {{umbilical.statusUpdate()}} and it gets an {{IllegalStateException}} because the task attempt is missing from {{attemptIdToStatus}}
7. In the {{catch}} block, {{System.exit(65)}} is eventually called

If step #7 runs quick enough, then the AM does not have the possibility to unregister from the Resource manager and it will be restarted. Sometimes it's slower so the unregistration succeeds.
My current proposal: in a finally block, stop the task reporter thread, so no it won't call {{statusUpdate()}} unnecessarily.
[~ajisakaa] [~jlowe] what do you guys think about the proposal?

There's a lot of important stuff that happens in the {{done}} method, like final counter updates and task commit  Why was that call removed?

Does ReduceTask need a similar update, or is this problem somehow specific to only map tasks?

I'm wondering if we should not allow Task to call System.exit when running in uber mode and instead let the AM decide what to do when a task fails in uber mode.  That may be a more general fix, as it could solve other scenarios where the task is tearing down the uber AM harshly and leaving no history.

Oops, {{done()}} was removed by accident. It should be there, obviously.

I'll check tomorrow whether reduce has similar problems.

Not calling {{System.exit()}} is a good idea. In general, I don't like exit calls at random places, it should be used more carefully.

Thinking about this a bit more, I'm not sure how shutting down the task reporter can completely fix the problem.  Even if we try really hard to let the task reporter know that it should not report, there's always going to be a race where the task reporter doesn't see in time that it should stop and makes the umbilical call just after the task is unregistered with the listener.  We then get the illegal state exception and boom, exit tears everything down.  That's why I think we should focus more on making sure the exception isn't immediately fatal to the entire process rather than try to make the umbilical exception impossible to happen.

[~jlowe] yes you're right, there's still a tiny time-window which allows things to go wrong.

I have an alternative idea: what about catching the exception that we throw? It could be a specialized exception instead of {{IllegalStateException}} so we know that the attempt has been removed from the map. If that happens, we just exit from the loop and stop reporting.

Checking for a specific exception would fix this particular instance, but I think we should fix the larger issue of subtasks tearing down the AM unexpectedly and therefore losing history.  There's already a config property we can check to see if the task is running in uber mode, {{mapreduce.task.uberized}}.  {{Task}} can pass that flag to the {{TaskReporter}} when it starts up so the reporter knows whether it should call {{System.exit}} when errors occur.
[~jlowe] uploaded POC v2, I think that's what you were thinking of, right? If so, then I'll update it later with some tests.

Thanks! That is what I was originally thinking, but looking at it closer, it will fail to stop the task from running like the exit used to.  In the case of the task not found problem I think we'd be OK in the uber case, since we know the AM will be feverishly trying to stop the task thread. Even if it fails to do so, the task will not be allowed to commit. However if the task hits task limit exceptions or other types of errors, the AM may not have any idea something is wrong with the task. Therefore we may want to keep the teardowns for some other cases. They are far from ideal, but at least they'll stop the job when they're supposed to.

I think completely and cleanly fixing subtask errors in uber AM is going to be involved and tricky, so we may not want to try to tackle all of the uber issues in this JIRA. I would like to get this unit test fixed, so here's an updated proposal:
 - Ditch the IllegalStateException in the listener and replace it with an AMFeedback that has the TaskFound bit cleared. That's a more gentle and already supported way of notifying the task that it is not known.
 - When the TaskReporter sees that the task is unknown it can shutdown its thread in uber mode. The AM will be handling the teardown of the subtask.

For the other cases where the reporter is calling exit we'd have to weigh carefully the risk of letting the task continue vs. tearing down the AM. That may be better to tackle in a followup JIRA since it could get tricky.  Thoughts?
[~jlowe] I updated the patch accordingly. Do you think we need a test for the uberized case to make sure that System.exit() is not invoked?

Thanks for updating the patch!

bq. Do you think we need a test for the uberized case to make sure that System.exit() is not invoked?

I think we're covered.  TestUberAM is failing if we allow the uber task to exit, so we already have a case of a unit test failing before the fix and fixed afterwards.

+1 for the latest patch.  Could you provide patches for the other targeted releases?  It does not apply cleanly to branch-2, and I assume it probably gets worse for the more distant branches.
I uploaded patches for 4 branches: branch-2, branch-2.9, branch-2.8 and branch-2.7.
